summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center's Legal Department, transmitting a hard drive containing discovery materials for the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which discovery materials are being transmitted.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The author of the letter, transmitting discovery materials in the Maxwell case.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is the prosecutor overseeing the government's case against defendant Maxwell.

events.title: Transmission of Discovery Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends a hard drive containing discovery materials pertinent to the Ghislaine Maxwell case to the Metropolitan Detention Center's Legal Department.

locations: Silvio J. Motto Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: This document is official correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It confirms the ongoing legal proceedings and discovery phase in the Maxwell case as of November 2020.
The document shows the U.S. Attorney's Office (specifically Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss) was actively managing evidence transmission to the detention facility where Maxwell was held.
